item.title: Grace add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Grace add a quote by Naomi Shihab Nye
item.description: "It is really hard to be lonely very long in a world of words. Even if you don't have friends somewhere, you still have language, and it will find you and wrap its little syllables around you and suddenly there will be a story to live in. " -- Naomi Shihab Nye

item.title: Grace add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "Only the margin left to write on now. I love you, I love you, I love you." -- Dodie Smith

item.title: Grace add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Grace add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Grace add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "Being a woman is a terribly difficult task, since it consists principally in dealing with men." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Grace add a quote by W.S. Merwin
item.description: "Poetry is a way of looking at the world for the first time." -- W.S. Merwin

item.title: Grace add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Grace add a quote by Maureen Corrigan
item.description: "It's not that I don't like people. It's just that when I'm in the company of others - even my nearest and dearest - there always comes a moment when I'd rather be reading a book." -- Maureen Corrigan

item.title: Grace add a quote by Hugh Laurie
item.description: "It's a terrible thing, I think, in life to wait until you're ready. I have this feeling now that actually no one is ever ready to do anything. There is almost no such thing as ready. There is only now. And you may as well do it now. Generally speaking, now is as good a time as any." -- Hugh Laurie

item.title: Grace add a quote by Jack Handy
item.description: "If you're in a war, instead of throwing a hand grenade at the enemy, throw one of those small pumpkins. Maybe it'll make everyone think how stupid war is, and while they are thinking, you can throw a real grenade at them." -- Jack Handy

item.title: Grace add a quote by Jack Handy
item.description: "Laurie got offended that I used the word "puke." But to me, that's what her dinner tasted like." -- Jack Handy
